ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Theories to justify why certain actions are wrong and why punishment is justified; how these can be applied to emerging forms of crime

I thought deeper about technology, technology in relation to human agency and freedom, and punishment with regard to technology. We discussed many questions I had never even thought of, so my eyes were opened to several new ideas and concepts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Engaging discussions with a professor that is encouraging and facilitates the discussion well; interesting topics!

Strengths: The content is so interesting! Professor Maggen is great at moderating conversation, teaching, yet also allowing for students to run the conversation, debate, and contribute. The papers allow students to choose topics they are more interested in within the topics of the course.
Weaknesses: Not many! If i had to think of one, I'd say some of the more theoretical readings could be less enjoyable and a bit confusing, but Professor Maggen explains them very clearly in class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! This was a fun course with interesting topics. Readings were very interesting and the reading load was not heavy. Assignments are chill and interesting to write; professor is friendly, approachable and facilitates discussions well
Absolutely! This course and the professor are both amazing. It's also a really great chance to learn from other Yale students, think deeply, and debate with each other.
